nodes.name: Emergent harmful behavior from composable steering system in real-world domain
aliases: dangerous emergent behavior in composite AI
nodes.description: Risk that combining individually non-dangerous, human-level components (world-model, pruning heuristic, evaluator) into a tree-search system controlling an internet-connected browser leads to high-impact irreversible real-world harm.
nodes.node_rationale: Introduced in “A sketch of a powerful steering system” and reiterated throughout as the main danger.

nodes.name: Lack of corrigibility constraints in tree-search planner
nodes.description: The system’s planner can freely execute actions without properties such as shutdownability, low-impact rules or operator oversight, leaving it uncontrollable.
nodes.node_rationale: Problem identified when comparing the baseline design to corrigibility desiderata.

nodes.name: Capability amplification via composition of human-level subsystems
nodes.description: Even if each component is only human-level and non-agentic, their straightforward composition into a search architecture yields overall super-human steering power.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in Background: steering systems as the key reason benign parts become dangerous together.

nodes.name: Applying corrigibility principles can mitigate risk but incur capability tax
nodes.description: Incorporating principles like Taskishness, Mild optimisation and Low-impact reduces dangerous behaviour but makes the system markedly less effective—the so-called ‘corrigibility tax’.
nodes.node_rationale: Stated in Conclusion and threaded through the applications section.

nodes.name: Bounding evaluation functions and quantilization induce mild optimization
nodes.description: If the evaluator is bounded and the planner chooses randomly among many adequate high-scoring world states (quantilisation), the system optimises only mildly, lessening extreme behaviour.
nodes.node_rationale: Detailed under “Mild optimisation” principle.

nodes.name: Impact regularization reduces downstream harm
nodes.description: Constraining the distance between predicted and current world states, or requiring futures to remain high-scoring after shutdown, limits collateral impact of executed actions.
nodes.node_rationale: Explored in “Low impact” subsection.

nodes.name: Integrating corrigibility principles into steering system design
nodes.description: Overall design strategy that embeds multiple small-length corrigibility principles (bounded tasks, mild optimisation, low impact, etc.) into the architecture before deployment.
nodes.node_rationale: Section “Applying each principle to the system” synthesises principles into a unified design plan.

nodes.name: Embedding human oversight loops at key decision points
nodes.description: Design choice to allow the system to pause and request operator advice, or have evaluators spot-checked by humans, improving corrigibility.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed under “Operator-looping” principle.

nodes.name: Restricting cognitive domains through whitelisting
nodes.description: Design approach where only pre-approved knowledge domains or reasoning styles are permitted, reducing the chance of modelling minds or out-of-scope optimisations.
nodes.node_rationale: Introduced in “Whitelisting” and linked to Behaviourism criterion.

nodes.name: Quantilized action selection over diverse high-scoring world states
nodes.description: Implementation where planner must return multiple sufficiently diverse world-state branches and randomly pick one, satisfying mild optimisation.
nodes.node_rationale: Concrete coding measure suggested in Mild optimisation section.

nodes.name: LLM dual-agent calibration and conservatism critique of plans
nodes.description: Pair of LLM agents – one generates plans with probabilities/utilities, a second audits them for calibration and uses ‘too-extreme’ thresholds.
nodes.node_rationale: Proposed under “Bounded utilities and probabilities”.

nodes.name: Distance-based impact metric check before action execution
nodes.description: Before executing an action, the system computes a distance in latent state-space between current and predicted world; execution is blocked if over threshold.
nodes.node_rationale: First concrete idea in Low impact subsection.

nodes.name: Operator consultation action available at every tree node
nodes.description: Adding an explicit ‘call operators’ action, which when selected suspends other branches until human feedback is integrated.
nodes.node_rationale: Implementation suggestion under Operator-looping.

nodes.name: World model future stability halt-prediction check
nodes.description: World-model simulates forward assuming the system halts; if predicted futures deviate outside safe bounds, execution is cancelled.
nodes.node_rationale: Second idea in Low impact subsection about ensuring safe trajectories after shutdown.

nodes.name: LLM critic enforcing domain whitelist adherence
nodes.description: Separate LLM examines proposed plan traces and rejects any that use reasoning outside an allowed list of domains.
nodes.node_rationale: Concrete mechanism in Whitelisting subsection.

nodes.name: Theoretical analysis of corrigibility tax indicates reduced risk but lower capability
nodes.description: Author’s argument that integrating the listed mechanisms would likely prevent catastrophic behaviours at the expense of significant performance reduction.
nodes.node_rationale: Summary conclusion in ‘Concluding thoughts’ and ‘Conclusion’ sections.

nodes.name: Design steering systems with bounded evaluation and quantilized planning
nodes.description: During algorithm design, formalise evaluator bounds and enforce quantilised action selection to prevent extreme optimisation.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Applies at architecture definition stage discussed under “Mild optimisation”.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: No empirical deployment yet; purely theoretical proposal in paper.
nodes.node_rationale: Direct actionable step derived from mild optimisation principle.

nodes.name: Embed operator consultation policies into planning loop
nodes.description: Fine-tune or RL-train the planner such that an ‘ask operator’ action is available and encouraged at pre-specified depths or uncertainties.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Implemented in RLHF/agent fine-tuning phase, per Operator-looping discussion.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Analogous interactive protocols have prototype demonstrations in LLM tooling.
nodes.node_rationale: Implements design rationale of embedding human oversight.

nodes.name: Integrate impact distance and halt-prediction safeguards pre-execution
nodes.description: Before deployment, add modules that compute latent-space distance thresholds and simulate futures with system halted, blocking unsafe actions.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Added during pre-deployment test harness per Low impact section.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Conceptual tools exist but lack systematic validation.
nodes.node_rationale: Actionable embodiment of distance-based low-impact checks.

nodes.name: Deploy LLM-based plan calibration and conservatism critics
nodes.description: Attach secondary LLMs that audit planner probabilities/utilities and flag extreme or poorly calibrated estimates before deployment.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Inserted into evaluation pipeline just before release, per Bounded utilities section.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Early experiments with debate / critique models exist but are not yet production hardened.
nodes.node_rationale: Operationalises dual-agent calibration mechanism.

nodes.name: Apply domain whitelist critic for cognitive restriction
nodes.description: Deploy an external critic that rejects any plan traces involving reasoning outside an approved list of domains (e.g., modelling minds).
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Added in safety testing harness per Whitelisting principle.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Pure proposal; no existing systems demonstrate strong whitelist governance yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Implements design rationale of domain restriction.

nodes.name: Limit operational tasks to concrete bounded pivotal acts
nodes.description: Organisational policy only permits the system to be run on narrowly-scoped, well-specified tasks rather than open-ended optimisation.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Enforced at deployment policy stage, aligning with Taskishness.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Conceptual policy recommendation; no systematic adoption yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Directly addresses taskishness requirement to bound goals.

edges.source_node: Emergent harmful behavior from composable steering system in real-world domain
edges.target_node: Lack of corrigibility constraints in tree-search planner
edges.description: Absence of explicit corrigibility makes dangerous actions possible.
